image.altText: An orange tarp is draped over a roof frame after the top was blown off.

props.synopsis: The Queensland government says it will take years to get homes repaired, after wild storms and flooding lashed the south-east over the Christmas holidays.

title.children: Storm-ravaged homes to take years to rebuild in Queensland after back-to-back natural disasters

image.altText: Rafael Nadal sitting appearing to be in pain with his hands on his hips.

props.synopsis: Rafael Nadal is out of the Australian Open and will return to Spain immediately to seek treatment for a muscle tear he sustained in his first tennis tournament back after nearly a year off with injury.

title.children: Rafael Nadal may have played in Australia for the final time, withdraws from AO

image.altText: crowd of people at a rave

props.synopsis: Seven of the eight people believed to have overdosed at Hardmission Festival were placed into induced comas and required breathing tubes.

title.children: Eight people in a critical condition following suspected drug overdose at a Melbourne rave

image.altText: A young boy practicing judo.

props.synopsis: James Gittus's family says the suit means the Tasmanian state judo champion can compete and train without an increased risk of injury as well as go to school full time.

title.children: NDIS says 'no' to funding state judo champion's special suit he needs to compete

image.altText: Eric Abetz

props.synopsis: Eric Abetz, the veteran conservative Liberal senator, has launched a bid to return to politics at the state level, saying he wants to "make a positive difference for the people of Tasmania".

title.children: Abetz seeking return to politics, to 'make a positive difference'

image.altText: Oxygen masks dangle in front of several plane seats with the window missing from a plane.

props.synopsis: The aircraft lost a window and a piece of fuselage, forcing it to make an emergency landing in Portland, Oregon.

title.children: Empty seats next to plane panel which blew out avoided potentially 'tragic' incident on Alaska Airlines flight says Safety Board

subjects.title: Air and Space Accidents and Incidents

image.altText: A tall tennis player stares down at the court in frustration as she gestures with her racquet and arms.

props.synopsis: Aryna Sabalenka's Australian Open title defence suffers a blow as a poor performance and injury timeout in the Brisbane final raise questions after her loss to Elena Rybakina.

title.children: 'Thank you for the three games!': Aryna Sabalenka laughs off Brisbane final thrashing by Elena Rybakina

image.altText: Alexander Zverev with his arms raised out in front of a crowd.

props.synopsis: Alexander Zverev has saved two match points to send Germany's United Cup final against Poland to a deciding mixed doubles rubber in Sydney.

title.children: Zverev digs deep to send United Cup final to the wire

image.altText: Several people stand amongst piles of rubble.

props.synopsis: Three months on from the conflict, western diplomats are trying to prevent the war from spreading, despite Israel continuing with its military campaign.

title.children: Conflict in Gaza intensifies as western diplomats seek ways to prevent war from spreading in Middle East

image.altText: Kim Yo Jong speaking into a lecturn with 5 microphones, wearing a black blazer.

props.synopsis: South Korea's Joint Chiefs of Staff said North Korea fired more than more than 90 rounds near the rivals' disputed western sea boundary on Sunday afternoon.

title.children: South Korea accuses North of firing artillery into sea for third straight day, as Kim sister mocks South's military

image.altText: Four men in suit.

props.synopsis: Japanese prosecutors make their first arrest on Sunday in connection with a major political slush funds scandal that has rocked Prime Minister Fumio Kishida's already unpopular government.

title.children: Japanese prosecutors make their first arrest in $6.19 million fundraising scandal sweeping the ruling party

image.altText: Cars submerged by floodwaters in Cairns.

props.synopsis: When the Bureau of Meteorology declared an El Niño, there were warnings of a hot and dry summer. But for thousands of Australians, that's not been the case at all. Why not?

title.children: Isn't it meant to be El Niño? Here's why it hasn't been the hot, dry summer we expected

image.altText: A man in green, gold and black points a gun. He is wearing headphones.

props.synopsis: A decision to refuse two-time Olympic gold medallist Michael Diamond's gun licence has been upheld, halting his plans to compete in the upcoming 2024 Paris Olympics qualifiers.

title.children: Shooting gold medallist Michael Diamond's gun ban upheld, dashing hopes for 2024 Paris Olympics

image.altText: Queen Margrethe wears a crown and ornate necklace with sash over her blue gown while seated for portrait

props.synopsis: After more than 50 years on the throne, Denmark's Queen Margrethe is abdicating to her son. But there was one man who could never come as close to the queen as her crown.

title.children: Queen Margrethe's husband brutally turned on her. But during his funeral, he made one final gesture of love

image.altText: A police officer stands near a police car at night.

props.synopsis: Police believe a string of stabbing attacks across Melbourne that left multiple people in hospital was random, with no connection between the accused and the victims.

title.children: Man charged over string of Melbourne stabbings which left multiple people in hospital

image.altText: A large crowd of people pushing each other.

props.synopsis: Multiple videos circulating on social media appear to show a brawl at Summernats involving dozens of men, some of whom are wearing "crowd safety" vests.

title.children: Police investigating brawl at Summernats with footage showing some involved wearing 'crowd safety' vests

image.altText: Split picture of two Australian Test cricketers, one standing with his baggy green on, the other batting with a helmet.

props.synopsis: Steve Smith's desire to replace David Warner as a Test opener is unlikely to be fulfilled, with coach Andrew McDonald concerned about moving him from number four.

title.children: Reluctance to move Steve Smith boosts Cameron Green's chances to open

image.altText: An older man standing in front of a long shop window.

props.synopsis: Hardware store owner Frank Penhalluriack faced massive fines, financial ruin and went to jail as he fought for what he believed in. He won, and has changed how we live, work and socialise.

title.children: Frank thought you should be able to do jobs around the house on weekends. It put him in jail

image.altText: A group of cyclists sitting on their bikes looking solemn, one cyclist comforts another with an arm around the other.

props.synopsis: Competitors at the three-day AusCycling Road National Championships in Ballarat have taken a moment of silence in honour of the renowned Olympian, who died on Saturday, December 30.

title.children: 'Amazing athlete': Cyclists pay touching tribute to beloved champion Melissa Hoskins

image.altText: The back of a woman standing in front of a moving blurry train

props.synopsis: This modern-day mystery has been reported for decades, and one expert studying the phenomenon believes he might know what causes the strange pulsating sound only some can hear.

title.children: The curious hum that only some people around the world seem to be able to hear

image.altText: A flat coral atoll at Cocos Keeling Islands

props.synopsis: Australia is surrounded by stunning islands — you may even spend time on one this summer. Join us on a whistle-stop tour to explore how some of our most iconic isles rose from the sea.

title.children: From Kangaroo to K'gari, find out how eight amazing Australian islands were born

image.altText: Australia batter David Warner touches his baggy green cap while smiling.

props.synopsis: David Warner's Test career was prolific, exciting and unique. Now that it's over, properly assessing his standing in the pantheon of Australian cricket is a challenge, writes Jon Healy.

title.children: David Warner is Australia's most prolific Test opener, but there's one major caveat around his status as a great of the game

image.altText: People hold protest signs with messages like 'Bridget must go' and 'Don't say 3-way'.

props.synopsis: Christian and Bridget Ziegler had been rising stars of the Florida Republicans, promoting conservative family values. Then came revelations of a threesome with a woman, who alleges she was later raped by Mr Ziegler.

title.children: A Florida power couple promoted the 'Don't Say Gay' law. Then came revelations of a threesome and an alleged assault

image.altText: A young woman leans casually against a truck

props.synopsis: After walking away from her dream career six years ago, Gemma is back on the horse where not even broken bones can keep her from reaching her goal.

title.children: Truck driver Gemma Hogg climbs back in the saddle to restart her jockey career

image.altText: A woman in a gold formal dress splashes into the sunny ocean.

props.synopsis: Every year these pleasure-seeking Australians take to the waves in suits and ball gowns to let off steam during the summer holiday silly season.

title.children: 'Like being washed in happiness': The formal-wear beach swim shoring up pleasure

image.altText: Angourie Rice sits in math class in a still from 2024's Mean Girls.

props.synopsis: Angourie Rice has a much-loved and much-watched DVD of the 2004 film version of Mean Girls, now she plays a starring role in its latest adaptation.

title.children: Angourie grew up watching iconic American high school films. Now, she's in one

image.altText: About 10 police officers talk near a car at a large crime scene on a suburban street.

props.synopsis: Police say a man fatally shot in Donnybrook on Melbourne's northern fringe was part of a group of armed intruders who seriously assaulted one of the residents moments before the shooting.

title.children: A man shot dead on a suburban street in Melbourne's outer north was an armed intruder, police say

image.altText: A painted portrait of a man with longer dark hair.

props.synopsis: A team of archaeologists discovered the remains of the 16th-century father of modern astronomy, who was the first to demonstrate that the Earth orbits the Sun.

title.children: Copernicus's grave was lost for centuries. An unlikely discovery finally solved the mystery

image.altText: cute puppy running towards the camera

props.synopsis: Canberra's RSPCA shelter is caring for more than double its usual number of animals.

title.children: This animal shelter is bursting at the seams with ferrets, galahs, kittens and puppies
